subsection_content:
Fascioliasis is a chronic parasitic infection of the biliary tract. The disease occurs when the main host (humans and herbivores such as goats, buffaloes, cows...) eat or drink food containing trematodes and become infected. (first)
According to classification, liver flukes are divided into two types: small liver flukes (including 3 types: Clonorchis sinensis, Opisthorchis viverrini, Opisthorchis felineus) and large liver flukes (including 2 types: Fasciola hepatica, Fasciola gigantica). In our country, the Northern region is often infected with large trematodes, while people infected with small liver flukes are mainly concentrated in the Central and Southern regions.
subsection_title: benh san la gan.json. What is liver fluke disease?
subsection_data:
benh san la gan.json. What is liver fluke disease?
Fascioliasis is a chronic parasitic infection of the biliary tract. The disease occurs when the main host (humans and herbivores such as goats, buffaloes, cows...) eat or drink food containing trematodes and become infected. (first)
According to classification, liver flukes are divided into two types: small liver flukes (including 3 types: Clonorchis sinensis, Opisthorchis viverrini, Opisthorchis felineus) and large liver flukes (including 2 types: Fasciola hepatica, Fasciola gigantica). In our country, the Northern region is often infected with large trematodes, while people infected with small liver flukes are mainly concentrated in the Central and Southern regions.
